qas.question: What do the findings in the graveyards show evidence of?
What kind of medicine was practiced in India before 2500 BC?
What is the name of the text that has information regarding Ayurveda?
What information is in the Susrutasamhita of Susruta?

context: Medicine: Findings from Neolithic graveyards in what is now <a0_0>Pakistan<a0_0/> show evidence of <a1_0>proto-dentistry<a1_0/> among an early farming culture. <a2_0>Ayurveda<a2_0/> is a system of traditional medicine that originated in ancient India before 2500 BC, and is now practiced as a form of alternative medicine in other parts of the world. Its most famous text is the <a3_0>Suśrutasamhitā of Suśruta<a3_0/>, which is notable for describing procedures on various forms of surgery, including rhinoplasty, the repair of torn ear lobes, perineal lithotomy, cataract surgery, and several other excisions and other <a4_0>surgical procedures<a4_0/>.
